DAMAGE CAUSED FROM MISHANDLING AND A MISSING BOTTLE. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHEWISE

DescribePack: Inspection of "BRANSON EC FORMULATED CLEANING CONCENTRATE" showed package to have evidence of being wet and closures open, with internal leakage, most likely from loose caps, and 2 of 4 items missing. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2023101000
item.description:
Report X-2023101000

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UPSIDE DOWN AND THAT IT WAS ALSO WET. MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO PROPERLY SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO START THE REPACK PROCESS. DescribePack: THE BOX ITSELF WAS UPSIDE DOWN, ARROWS FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING. TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE WERE ALSO FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION. ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING IT TO LEAK. APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT ONTO CAUSING THE BOX TO BE ALL WET AND START RIPPING APART. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDICATELY OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2023100981
item.description:
Report X-2023100981

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100981 SequenceEvent: Package was found in a truck that came back from deliveries. It was then put in a red tote and hazmat bag and placed in the hazmat cage for processing. This happened on 10/10/2023 about 14:oo. DescribePack: The package was wet and deteriorating. One of the 5-liter bottles that was in the box had a loose cap. It leaked in and out of the box, wetting a couple of other hazmat boxes. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a red Hazmat tote and Hazmat bag. It was then taken to the Hazmat cage, where it was processed. 2. X-2023101000 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UPSIDE DOWN AND THAT IT WAS ALSO WET. MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO PROPERLY SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO START THE REPACK PROCESS. DescribePack: THE BOX ITSELF WAS UPSIDE DOWN, ARROWS FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING. TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE WERE ALSO FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION. ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING IT TO LEAK. APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT ONTO CAUSING THE BOX TO BE ALL WET AND START RIPPING APART. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDICATELY OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2023100895
item.description:
Report X-2023100895

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found on van line oily. Box was isolated from sort by manager. As box is unlabeled/hazmat undeclared, manager placed box into a black non-hazmat bin to transfer to QA cage. DescribePack: Outer package is oily, but otherwise appears undamaged; there are no puncture marks or tears on the outer box. Items packed very loosely in box with minimal packing material. No hazmat stickers or indicators on box or label. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon delivery to QA cage, QA inspected package, discovering undeclared aerosol hazmat. Package was transferred to a red hazmat bin lined with a plastic hazmat bag. Leak almost 100% contained within box; smear of oil on belt cleaned with disposable absorbent cloth pads.

item.title: Report X-2023100838
item.description:
Report X-2023100838

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler notified management that package was leaking. Acid neutralizing absorbent powder was placed down on and around spill. Hazmat was then placed in a plastic hazmat bag and red tub and brought to QA Hazmat cage for inspection. Powder was swept up and placed in hazmat bag, zip tied and brought to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Two bottles of liquid had cracks in them on the outside approximately half way down the sides. Both bottles were on the same side of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Acid neutralizing absorbent powder was placed down on and around spill. Hazmat was then placed in a plastic hazmat bag and red tub and brought to QA Hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023100652
item.description:
Report X-2023100652

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REFUSED BY RECIPIENT BECAUSE OUTER PACKAGING WAS WET. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 16X 1 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) VIDEOJET CLEANING SOLUTION WITH ONE BOTTLE HAVING A LOOSE CAP WHICHED CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 100% SPILLAGE OF THE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

DescribePack: The package had a crack at the bottom of the bottle and it had caused to leak all over inside the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A manager was able to have a red tote and a plastic clear bag near by and was able to put the damage hazmat into the tote taking precaution.

item.title: Report X-2023100634
item.description:
Report X-2023100634

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND ON IT'S SIDE. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO HANDLE THE REPACK PROCESS. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND SECURELY AND ALSO IN A TIMELY FASHION. DescribePack: PART B HAD A LOOSE CAP AND WHEN BOX WAS TURNED ON IT'S SIDE THE LOOSE CAP CAUSE IT TO LEAK APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OUT ONTO THE PACKAGE AND THE INNER CONTAINERS OF PART A. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I REPACKED IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A SAFE AND TIMELY FASHION TO AVOID ANY FURTHER EXPOSURE FOR THE CHEMICALS.

item.title: Report X-2023100627
item.description:
Report X-2023100627

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION 1 BOTTLE OF ETHYL ACETATE WAS FOUND CRACKED AND FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE PACKAGE WAS HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS CAUSED FROM THE BOX BEING DROPPED AND 1 BOTTLE OF ETHYL ACETATE BECAME CRACKED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023100358
item.description:
Report X-2023100358

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: on 09/12/2023 at approximately 1845, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 234302 at the hub facility in Newark, reporting an undeclared flammable liquid spill. The shipment is a gas-powered generator, containing a resudue of gasoline. The shipment was discovered due to odor and a stained outer package. The shipment was not prepared as a fully regulated dangerous goods shipment, without having the required marking, labeling, packaging and paperwork, in accordance with IATA regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023100602
item.description:
Report X-2023100602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND UNDER THE CONVEYOR BELT IN A HAZMAT BIN. DPR, ISF, 105 WAS DONE. PKG WAS REPACKED AND RETURN LABLE WAS DONE. PKG WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE AWAITING DISPOSITION DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESS AND PREPACKED AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE, WHILE AWAITING DISPOSITON.
